Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms and clean.”
Reviews.Author: DanieloSussi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for ~1 week while on vacation in Dubai. The rooms are huge (apartments, with a kitchen area), and clean and modern. There are two TV's, a seperate bedroom, and cleaning is great. The breakfast buffé is OK, nothing special. More western style breakfast wouldn't hurt... But that's nothing I can complain about. Lots of fresh fruit, which is awesome. Service was OK, they were helpful when we asked for help. The pool on the roof is excellent when it's a hot day in Dubai and you don't have the nergy to take the cab to the beach. It's clean and a nice chill-out area. However, during our stay, they performed some work in the pool area, and it was closed for some days. They compensated it by directing us to another nearby hotel, also with a pool on the roof. That's good service. The location is not that good however. It's not that far from the metro (both red and green line), and around the metro there are some convinience stores and restaurants. But to get to the new modern Dubai (the Malls, and the Marina), it's a 20 min ride with the Metro. And to get to the old parts, you can walk (~20 min), or take a cab. But its not 'around the corner'. The area where the hotel is located is mostly full of other hotesl, or apartment buildings. It's safe, but not very touristy. All in all, a good hotel, we can recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigbozfriend
Reviews.Content: We specifically booked this hotel as it was a hotel apartment and it gave us more options than a usual hotel room would. Check-in was efficient, although the attendant took an age to bring us our bags. The bed was very comfortable. The bedroom portion had sufficient lighting and had two adaptors for our various plugs which is something that you do not see everyday. Both the TV in the bedroom and lounge had a variety of channels, although the reception was not good. Not sure if that is a hotel specific, or Dubai specific problem. The bathroom was spacious, had sufficient cupboard space and storage for bags. The shower was not great, more a dribble than a flow. The overall room was tidy, but a bit dated. We enjoyed having a mini kitchen, with fridge, microwave, sink etc. The reception were helpful in arranging excursions and taxis. The location to a Spinneys and the Burjuman Mall was good, but obviously further to get to the other spots. Taxis are cheap and plentiful so that was not a problem. The only real gripe we had was that we booked and paid for a room with a balconey. We did not get one, despite management saying they would move us. They also said that there is no price difference, although their website showed there was a small AED25 per day difference. If this could have been resolved, I would have been happier. The pool on top of the roof is clean and we enjoyed some time there. There is also a jacuzzi there and that was good. We had room service the one evening which was fine. The price seemed to be reasonable for Dubai, which can be very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and hospitalty”
Reviews.Author: marina11Lagos
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel with great and happy staff.Walkable distance to the metro station and the max mall.We wont hesitate to use it again.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: ASingh2005
Reviews.Content: USP - Centrally located, helpful accomodative staff. Super store spinney and station at walkable distance. Housekeeping good, but if you are cooking anyhting in kitchen the utensils need to be washed yourself. Shower sytem needs to be put in place but think thats a minor problem. Assistance available for any of your desesrt safatri or other adventure trips at hotels desk, but suggest go direct for a better deal. Airport pickup and drops also available at almost the same price without any markups.Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely apartments in a quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: MariaCB
Reviews.Content: The prime reason for choosing Savoy Suites Hotel Apartments was its location on 12th Street off Kuwait Street. This area of Bur Dubai, heavily populated with hotels, between Kuwait Street and the busy Khalid Bin Al Waleed Road looks to me more like a residential quarter. It is a quiet neighborhood where you can find a variety of shops within a walking distance, from the Burjuman Mall to Spinneys supermarkets. Two metro stations are also nearby: Al Karama and Khalid Bin Al Waleed. The hotel is about a 15 minute taxi ride from the airport. The check-in was smooth and the staff friendly, particularly the employee who cleaned my room. My apartment was spacious with a bedroom separated by a sliding door from the living-room and a well equipped kitchenette. The bed was comfortable and the room very quiet although overlooking the street with a balcony. The kitchenette included an electric four plate stove, a microwave, a toaster, an electric kettle, a fridge and a washing-machine. Everything I could possibly want for a one week stay. In addition to 2 flat TVs there is a free wired internet connection with a reasonable speed in the rooms. The only flaw I could find was in the bathroom. The hand basin towel rack does not exist and the towels hang over the bathtub so that I had to stretch over the tub to reach them. I presume that the position of the towel rack is intended for tall people (which is not may case) but even though I fail to see the logic of it! Other than this minor flaw, I had a wonderful and peaceful stay at the Savoy Suites at a fairly reasonable price for Dubai standards. There is also a complimentary two-level parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: lokeshnathany
Reviews.Content: I visit Dubai regularly and prefer to stay at Savoy Suites for very good service, excellent room with amenities and very attentive staff. The rooms are very spacious and definitely bigger then most of the hotels I have stayed in. There is a living room besides the bedroom and both the rooms have LCD TV. For Indian guests another advantage is that it has more Indian TV channels as compared to other hotels including cricket matches telecast. The place is well within walking distance of Metro station, shopping area and good food joints. Overall I will strongly recommend both for business and family travel.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay at....”
Reviews.Author: MEtraveller11
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights, overall experience was nice, it is a clean hotel, next to Burjman commercial Mall, where you can catch the metro to almost everywhere in dubai, the room service price is good (cheap comparing to dubai), wired internet was available in the room and wireless service was only available at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Deffinatly stay again”
Reviews.Author: Lewis C
Reviews.Content: We are a young coupe of 19 and 20 as soon as we arrived we were greeted with a fresh tropical fruit juice and smile. The staff are more than helpful and always try and assist you with your baggage. We arrived in the room to everything smelling very fresh and clean. The room was very spacious and having the little kitchenette was useful. It is close to the burjuman mall. The mall has lots of shops and places to eat which was very useful also spinnys super market was close by. Overall i would deffinatly reccommend this hotel to anyone. Very pleasant stay. And very good price :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay; value for money”
Reviews.Author: Prathams
Reviews.Content: The best place i like about this is its location, near to apsara departmental store where i buy all my indian stuff to take to cairo. Also next to meena bazaar where i can stroll around. The is pure value for money. Very clean. Breakfast is ultimate for an indian specially if he is a vege. Staff are very polite and helpful

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: Firi2011
Reviews.Content: We were a bit anxious as not all the reviews were good. This hotel is great the staff are Sooooooo friendly and nothing is to much trouble. The rooms were clean and spacious. Read earlier reviews if issues with hot water but we had no problems and most of the time didn't even switch on water heater before shower as water was very very hot and plentiful. We paid for breakfast separately at 35D each person per day but they didnt charge for our 2 kids so was a good deal. We were round the corner from Spinneys Supermarket and 5min walk to kaleej Centre so eatin out was not a problem. We have stayed in many hotels and apartments both in Dubai and other countries but THIS IS THE BEST AND THE PRICE IS REASONABLE AS WELL

Reviews.Title: “excellent we will be back”
Reviews.Author: icelolly25
Reviews.Content: Firstly the staff were very helpful and the reception very kind. When we arrived they even had small gifts for my children. They helped order food from pizza hut and when the pizza guys brought the wrong soft drink they sent a guy out to get it from another store. The rooms are spacious and nice I especially like the two room ones though the bathrooms a little small and tight but for the money fine. We have stayed in a lot of serviced apartments but we have now found the one we like and we will not be changing to another as long as the service continues.

Reviews.Title: “RAK- ACACIA HOTEL -GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DubaiMarc
Reviews.Content: We drove from Dubai to Ras Al Khaimah - 45 mins run. Went with the Family. rooms were comfortable, everything to the hotel standard, good friendly staff. Close by to the Hotel is the ICELAND WATER PARK.Avoid going there in extreme heat - or you will get badly sun burnt. Food choice for breakfast was excellent as well as the dinner buffet. Search for the special promos whcih includes food as well as the trip to the Iceland Park.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Savoy Suites”
Reviews.Author: stronger123
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be a good choice for our group of 6. We rented a 2 bedroom apartment with 1 extra bed (they charged us for the 2 extra people, which was expected). They held our passports to scan these which was a bit weird but returned it promptly afterwards. The apartments were easy to find and located in a quiet neighborhood in Bur Dubai (10 mins walk from Burjuman mall and metro station and about 15-20 mins from Meena Bazaar). It tooks us about 15 mins by cab from the airport and 10-15 mins by cab from most major attractions. The check in was smooth and the hotel staff especially Mr. Usman were very friendly and greeted us warmly with fresh juice and dates. They initially offered us a smoking suite and took a few hours to change it to non-smoking, but offered complimentary tea and coffee. The rooms were nice and spacious. The living room was smaller with a small kitchenette. There were 2 flat screen TV's, a small balcony, 2 large bathrooms. The rooms were very clean and nicely decorated. There was a gas stove, microwave, dishwasher, basic dinnerware and cutlery, coffee machine, hairdryer etc. The staff provided personal attention each time, addressing us with our names. We used the rooftop pool and jacuzzi which was very nice. These were not heated but we didn't mind as it was quite hot that day. There was a gym and separate sauna/steam rooms for men and women. The restaurant/cafe was quite good but a bit expensive (35 Aed for breakfast) compared to local standards. We ate out most of the times (lots of excellent cheaper Indian and other restaurants in meena bazaar). They also offered a complimentary fruit basket with great quality fresh fruits and water bottles on the first day. The room service was prompt and housekeeping was offered daily. They provided basic toiletteries and equipments and overall, we were happy and satisfied with the value. Free shuttle was available every morning to Jumeirah beach and the metro station. Free wired internet was available in both our bedrooms and there was free wifi in the lobby. They could provide free wifi in the rooms too and perhaps a free shuttle to/from the airport. But overall, this is a good option to stay in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with reasonable pricing”
Reviews.Author: n_marjo
Reviews.Content: - Great hotel for adult travellers with good facilities - Excellent and helpful personnel - Location provides quiet environment and good shopping places nearby (Karama district)

Reviews.Title: “Very goo breakfast, great stuff”
Reviews.Author: mianaBG
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to stay near "old" part of Dubai and Dubai Mall. If you prefer Dubai Marina, stay somewhere else. Large and clean rooms, very good bad. Good materials chosen for interior but without designer touch. Very reasonable price for quality. Only negative thing is a smell of the room. Not so bad, but I prefer rooms with no smell at all. Also, the hotel has a free wi-fi in room but you cannot use Skype in Emirates

Reviews.Title: “Apartment/Suite hotel - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: lortzing
Reviews.Content: Nice apartment suites with fully equipped kitchenette & washing machine/dryer, safe, free wired internet, two flatscreen TVs, sofa & bathtub, and free daily newspaper. It's worth to upgrade to balcony room. My room looked exactly like the pictures here on tripadvisor. Small clean rooftop pool, terrace, and small but fully functional gym. 10-15 min walk to 2 Metro stations. 8-10 min walk to large supermarkets, fast food outlets, and Bur Juman shopping mall. Hotel does not have a bar, but several other hotels with bars are within easy walking distance (best to buy alcohol in airport duty free shops in Arrivals). Daily free transport to beach. I was able to check in early and check out late without extra charge. I believe, Savoy group hotels do not allow unmarried couples to check in or to have female visitors in the room. Beware of very loud private rooftop functions during Thur-Sat nights (until about 01:00 AM) which will prevent you from sleep on higher floors. Reception did not warn me about this upon check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in worse.”
Reviews.Author: richie03
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in the Savoy Suites. The room was big and comfortable, clean and well kept. No complaints there. The only things that stick in my mind is the lack of bar which isn't ideal, although the Romada is only 2 or 3 minutes walk and has a good bar, and the hot water must be turned on 20 minutes before you can use it. I was working very long days so just wanted to walk in the room, take a shower then leave to get something to eat but had to hang around and wait for the water.. All in all, its fine but but in Dubai you can do better for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Relazing , well services”
Reviews.Author: Amit_kasera
Reviews.Content: Hi, Savoy suites is convienently located, and offers good value for money for business travellers. The rooms are comfortable, with all facilities, kichennate, and with a pool on the top. The attendants are courteous and you are greeted at the reception with a smile. overall, a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: ANDREAGOULD
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay. Everywhere is spotless. Food great. Staff really helpful. Can't fault it. Going back again Nov-2010!

Reviews.Title: “Apartment hotel - check-in here if in town for long..!!”
Reviews.Author: thewanderer-nammo
Reviews.Content: Savoy is a decent sized, typical Bur dubai apartment hotel.. within walking distances to the luxurioys Bur Jumaan mall and the bur jumaan metro station, it is a perfect bet if you are in town for business in the nearby or Deira areas..tourists can also take advantage of the metro and explore the majestic city of Dubai at their own will.. within close proximity is also located the old town shopping charm of Bur dubai.. Rooms - decently spacious rooms..with a separate lounge area.. separate LCD's in the bedroom as well as the lounge/living area.. decent size bath.. in house washer/dryer.. and a kitchentte comes inclusive as well.. thus makes for a perfect stay if you are in town for more than 15 days or so.. roof top swimming pool n jacuzzi.. in house restaurant.. workable gym are some of the other facilites this hotel offers.. in close vicinity are few department stores for day to day grocery.. to conclude.. if you are looking for a perfect value long stay hotel.. this one will work just well..

Reviews.Title: “A high quality, low price hotel in a great location in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: OrbitalElement
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Savoy Suites and I am very happy to give the place an excellent all-round rating. The hotel has huge rooms, with a separate bedroom area and a large living room, with a small kitchenette area. The staff are friendly and helpful and the inclusive breakfast is excellent too. The hotel has room service and a lunch/dinner menu but I didn't try these. Perhaps the only downside is that the hotel doesn't have an alcohol licence, so there is no bar and no wine or beer with meals. The location is excellent, in the Bur Dubai area. The Burjuman shopping mall is only 10 minutes walk away and has great shopping and plenty of eating places. You can pick up the Big Bus tour at Burjuman too, and the new metro line has a station on the corner in front of Burjuman, so you can easily get to many of Dubai's other places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Savoy feels like home”
Reviews.Author: anandanpll
Reviews.Content: Its a great place to live, The rooms are great, the service is good also the amenities make you fell like home. The location is also good to freak around in the evening. Overall a very good experience with the hotel

Reviews.Title: “The most kindly staff, you can imagine.”
Reviews.Author: BlobDenmark
Reviews.Content: We just came back after 7 nights stay at the Savoy Suites - march 2nd - 9th. I had red the reviews here, before booking, and I was a bit sceptical - but it was the only hotel available with our travelagenzy, so we took the chance. WHICH we DON'T regret. The hotel has a good location (where in Dubai are you not expected to walk a bit to reach your destination?). It is extremely clean, fresh, modern, contains all you need, and if you should happen to need more, the kind staff will get it for you at once. The suites are very fine - spacy and clean, and the bathroom is perfect too. The poolarea is not big, but very, very cosy, and at this time of the year, it is more than big enough. The "CoffeeShop" serves a great breakfastbuffet, and to our big surprise, they change the "hot dishes" (8 of them) from day to day, so you don't have the same on the buffet every day. You can easily take a dinner at the restaurant in the evening. A good rib-eye with french fries, a choise between 3 different sauces, and served with 6 - yes SIX - different kind of vegetables, for the small amount of 40 dirhams. I see, that many users on this site "complaints" about noise from constructionworks.....well, show me a place in Dubai, where there are no constructions going on.......and for the moment, there are NO such noise around the Savoy Suites. With a few words: it was a WONDERFUL and PERFECT base for our stay in Dubai, and I wouldn't hessitate chosing the same place again, if I come back to Dubai again.

Reviews.Title: “The real name is Savoy suites hotel Dubai”
Reviews.Author: BibiStockholm
Reviews.Content: Took one week off with my 75-yearold mother anf flew to Dubai. Checked in and was stunned by how modern and nice the apartment was. When we took the curtains aside we were not that thrilled anymore... A building was under construction and 6 o´clock in the morning, they started to work. The staff on the hotel would not let us have a new room for the whole week!!! Terrible. Breakfast was fantastic. but miss Ella and the man in the reception were so unfriendly, although they were smiling. Dubai is a fantastic city, but next time I go there, it will be in aprox. 5-7 years. There is buildings under constructions everywhere. And don´t believe people who say they don´t expect tip in taxis! Sounds like I am disappointed but we really had fun in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: JamesMyerson
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Dubai for 3 nights at this hotel on our way to Sri Lanka, and were reasonably impressed. We travelled with Mercury Direct and the choice of hotel options for the Dubai stopover seemed limited so we went for one with reasonable reviews. The hotel is really more of a 'base' than a holiday destination in it's own right. It has very clean and cool lobby with a cafe area which serves at the breakfast area also (breakfast is OK - not a huge amount of choice and some strange options due to the lack of bacon/pork, etc as Dubai is a Muslim country, but good enough). First impressions of the room was very positive - there is a large lounge/kitchenette area and then a bedroom area further in. The bed was extremely comfortable after an exhausting, and very hot, day in Dubai. The bathroom was clean and tidy. The air conditioning worked very well and another 'must' for Dubai. It's VERY HOT outside. There are 2 LCD TVs in the room, but rather limited channel choices. There is a fridge (good to keep cool water in) and a hob if needed. The gym up on the roof is small, as is the pool (not much more than a plunge pool really), and seems a little bit of an afterthought when the hotel was built, but as I said, this hotel isn't a 'holiday destination' and more of a 'base' to explore from. We only had 2 full days in Dubai but packed a lot in: The old town area is worth a visit, but seemed rather deserted when we were there, and the museum is also quite good with a look at the history of Dubai (plus it's air conditioned in parts!). The spice souk was disappointing, and the gold souk is full of shops and shops of gold and all a bit overwhelming - we found a small watch shop and got 2 very nice Swiss watches at a very good price. The trip across the Dubai creek on the boat taxis is an interesting experience, just be ready to jump off at the other end! An evening dhow cruise (they pick up from the hotel) was a lovely way to spend an evening with very good food (air conditioned, again!) but rather mediocre entertainment. Dune bashing in a 4x4 out in the desert + dinner at the bedouin village (complete with belly dancers) was also great fun. If you like water parks, then Wild Wadi is worth a visit - not quite on the scale of Blizzard Beach or Typhoon Lagoon in Orlando, but some entertaining water rides. A maximum of 5 days is probably enough in Dubai - it's an unusual mix of the old and new, the concrete and the desert, but very welcoming and growing fast.

Reviews.Title: “stop over for a family of five”
Reviews.Author: ziggyDurham
Reviews.Content: I found the reception staff at the hotel very helpful. They explained the free excursions from the hotel and other options to tour the city. The rooms were comfortable and quite large. The breakfast lacked in choice but was more than adaquate. The rooftop swimming pool and gym were small and I imagine crowded should more than a couple of rooms visit simultaniously. However my children loved it as we were the only visitors. The outlook around the hotel is very bland but it is only five minutes walk from the Burjuram shopping centre. The big bus company runs from there which for us was the best method of seeing the city. The red route is interesting but the blue route shows you around a very large building site. Dubai is perfect if you like shopping and concrete but was not for me. The hotel is perfect for this short break being only ten minutes from the airport which I thought to be comfortable and very fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dave2749
Reviews.Content: I have been required to stay at the Savoy Hotel Apartments on and off since early 2006. Our company dictated that we stay at this hotel since they were picking up the tab. My last stay there was in March 2007. I've stayed there approximately 6 times. I've read several of the reviews and I wonder if the people who wrote the reviews actually have stayed at this same property. Let's go down the list. The service is average. The food would have to be considered average to below average. If you miss the standard meal times, good luck getting a hot meal served in a reasonable amount of time. The rooms-below average by Dubai standards. Think Motel 6 with a tile floor instead of carpet. The pool, again, think Motel 6. It's located on the roof but is extremely small, the lounge chairs very cheap, no decorations or scenery to speak of and the adjacent gym is a tiny room by any standard. We have been lobbying our company to switch hotels for us now since our first stay at the Savoy Apartment Hotel and we just received news that our efforts may have finally paid off. We will be switching in the near future and we are ALL happy for that. Dubai simply has too many nice hotels in a similar price range to stay at this very bland and impersonal property. I'm usually not this critical and am definitely not a "nitpicker" but after repeated stays here, I can't wait to switch to a different property.

Reviews.Title: “Give this a try..you'll be surprised”
Reviews.Author: ChrisGilbert
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a magnificent 5 nights in Dubai and I can honestly say that the staff at the Savoy Hotel apartments made it all the better. We chose this accomodation based on the reviews that fellow travellers had written and given that we were wary of staying on Jumaireh beach with its vast construction work going on. We arrived early morning after an overnight flight from the uk and were allowed to check in immediately.We were greeted with fresh juice and complimentary bottled water in the room. The studio apartment had washing machine, cooking facilities,iron together with the normal hotel room facilities. Breakfast was included in the price and this was well presented and plentiful. The staff while extremely attentive were not obtrusive and went about their roles to ensure the visitor was made to feel special. The rooftop pool was a marvellous retreat to cool off and often we were the only people there - bliss! There was little noise and no major construction work surrounding the hotel. If you don't want to stay on the beach give this little gem a try...you'll be glad you did - we were.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel with good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't the fanciest in Dubai, but it is clean, safe and located in a good spot. There are many places to see that are within walking distance, and the area seems to be safe. They also offer a shuttle that goes to several different spots that are out of walking distance. The staff was for the most part quite friendly as well. For the price that I paid for my room, it was a definite bargain. I would have no problem staying here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Savoy Suites Hotel Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: Mankhool 12 A Bur Dubai | PO Box 28950, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
